intro: Bastardia viscosa var. novogranatensis, commonly known as the sticky bastardia, is a succulent plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, characterized by its fleshy, water-storing leaves and flowers. The plant is notable for its thick, sticky secretions on its stems and leaves, which help reduce water loss in arid environments. Its small, star-shaped flowers are typically yellow or orange, adding ornamental value. It thrives in well-drained soil and requires minimal water, making it suitable for xeriscaping and rock gardens.
